noun.description: A cloth on which to stand, kneel, or rest the feet; a carpet or rug, especially for the use of royalty or dignitaries.
A large, richly ornamented cloth, considered as a mark of dignity and state and laid over the back of a horse so as to hang down to the ground on each side.

origin: Middle English; earliest use found in Wardrobe Account Edward III. From foot + cloth.
